TEI.2.document_title: Henry S. Brown to Stephen F Austin, 03-21-1828

barker_notes.barker_summary: Henry S. Brown to Austin, New Orleans, March 21, 1828. There would be great emigration to Texas if status of slavery assured.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 27

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Henry S. Brown to Austin, New Orleans, March 21, 1828. There would be great emigration to Texas if status of slavery assured.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleanes*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-21-1828">March the 21 1828*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Auston*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear sir I will inform you that I am still alived and have not for got the *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*I expect that I shall start with my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*for that *location_mentioned*Contry */location_mentioned*this fall there is a good deal of talk about that *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* in the *location_mentioned*Missouri */location_mentioned*and there is no doubt but the disturbance that took piase in *location_mentioned*edwards Colloney*/location_mentioned* Caused a good many that was strongly in the way to moove to decline tho I think when they find every thing is going on well there a good many will moove from our *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*there if it was so to happin that that *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*was [to] fall in the hands of our *person_mentioned*goverment */person_mentioned*how son would it be one of the gratest, or in other words if slavery was admitted there or the people Cold be satisfied that they would be safe in taking there *person_mentioned*slaves */person_mentioned*there the emmigration would be grate I wold thank you to wright me on that subject and every other one that wold give information about the tines [times] of that *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*one letter from you would do more good than 20 from some other men, I have bin informed after a certain time there cold be no more [*person_mentioned*slaves*/person_mentioned*?] taking there perhaps after the first of *date_mentioned n="01-01-1829">January */date_mentioned*next tho that will give time for people to move this *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1828">fall */date_mentioned*it is uncertain what part of the *location_mentioned*Contry */location_mentioned*I shall settle in tho I believe that I shall try near the *location_mentioned*cost*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Henry S Brown*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S F Auston*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*N b give my best respects to *person_mentioned*Mr S Williams*/person_mentioned* tell him I would thank him kindley for a letter) my plase of residence *location_mentioned*Missouri Pike*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Col Waverley*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col Stephen F Auston*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Austons Colloney Texas */location_mentioned* by *person_mentioned*Capt Harris*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
